intro: Corydalis sheareri, commonly known as the Sierra madre corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in early spring. Corydalis sheareri is often found in open woodlands and meadows, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
